What happened to Diablo Immortal?
04 Nov 2019, 10:34 by Lorenzo Delli
Do you remember Diablo Immortal? This is the spin-off of the famous Blizzard series dedicated to mobile devices presented at the BlizzCon 2018. The 2019 edition of BlizzCon focused on the most important news, such as Diablo 4, Overwatch 2 and World of Warcraft: Shadowland, leaving unfortunately, little space for a project that is in some ways equally interesting.
Diablo Immortal has not fallen by the wayside, indeed. Blizzard herself dedicated space to him during the events following the opening ceremony, also publishing a dedicated post on her blog, also answering some interesting questions.


What is Diablo Immortal?


Blizzard calls it an action MMORPG featuring all the gamers' favorite Diablo game elements. Being an MMORPG some aspects of the game will be similar to other titles already seen on mobile devices.


What makes Diablo Immortal different?


Having used the word MMORPG may worry you. In reality the solo experience will be there anyway, but there will also be areas that are always shared, repeatable expeditions for four players, guilds and much more.


Where is it located chronologically?


Among the events of Diablo 2 and Diablo 3.


What are the playable classes?


You are in everything: barbarian, crusader, demon hunter, monk, necromancer and magician.


Are there new game mechanics?


Yes, at BlizzCon 2019 the Ultra were shown in action, which are loaded via the basic attacks.


When it comes out?


Blizzard has not yet decided on the release date. There is talk of the first weeks of 2020.
We conclude everything with a new gameplay video that shows us some of the new ad-hoc zones created for the chapter and other news.
